result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D. Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $15.00 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Shelly R, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  (DOC-2156)  Def. has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program, and the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of confinement time not served will be added to extended supervision time.  Total length of sentence will not be changed.  DOC shall determine the number of days converted from confinement to extended supervision based on actual release date.
for restitution
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP consecutive to 13CF1327 & 13CF1345; 2 years initial confinement; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; pay $15 restitution.

Restitution Determined  - $15.00.
This total does not include 10% surcharge due Kenosha Co. Clerk of Courts.
For Restitution Order
